par.text: Tin is a silvery-white, soft metal. It is highly ductile and malleable and is easily rolled into very thin sheets. Polished tin is bluish, which is a result of the reaction with oxygen from air. The resulting tin(IV) oxide Sn
forms a protective layer, eliminating further corrosion. Two allotropic forms are known: white and grey tin. White tin is stable above 13.2

C, while grey tin is stable below this temperature. An interesting property of tin is the characteristic ”cry” heard when bending a tin rod. Tin was known in ancient times. The name is derived from the Latin name of the element,
